p: In this study, the majority of exotic species at the roadsides belonged to the Asteraceae and Poaceae families, results that coincide with other studies carried out on the roadsides in southern Chile [ 22] and in the center of Argentina [ 61]. These families contribute a large number of exotic invasive species to the worldâ€™s flora [ 62]. Many of these invader species have spreading strategies related to efficient long-distance wind or animals dispersal [ 14, 40, 63].
